questions.text: What car company's slogan is "I love what you do for me"?
questions.explanation:
Toyota.

	Toyota started their first car company in 1933, but it had started making cars in 1926.

options: GWFOTHAW: Goodbye wonderful friends of the Hundred Acre Wood
questions.explanation:
TTFN: ta ta for now.

	Although Disney now owns the rights to Winnie the Pooh and all his friends, he did not create them. Tigger, and all the other animals that live in the Hundred Acre Wood, was created by A.A. Milne.  Christopher Robin was the son of A.A. Milne.

questions.text: What does the "T" stand for in Woody T. Boyd?
questions.explanation:
Tiberius.

	Woody Boyd shares his middle name "Tiberius" with Captain Kirk of "Star Trek".  Woody Harrelson, who played Woody Boyd on "Cheers", has the same middle initial as Woody Boyd. Harrelson's middle name is Tracy.

questions.text: What is the softest mineral, according to Mohs' Scale of Hardness?
questions.explanation:
Talc.

	Talc is only a 1 on the hardness scale. It is used for talc powder. Gypsum is 2 on the hardness scale. It is used for plaster of paris. Quartz is 7 on the scale and diamond, the hardest, is 10. Both quartz and diamonds are used in jewelry.

questions.text: Who married Miss Vicki on "The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson"?
questions.explanation:
Tiny Tim.

	Tiny Tim and Miss Vicki were married in 1969. They divorced in 1971 and had a daughter named Tulip.

questions.text: What is the first perfect square that starts with "T"?
questions.explanation:
twenty-five.

	The first ten perfect squares are 1,4,9,16,25, 36,49,64,81,100. A square is found by multiplying a number by itself. For example 5x5=25.

questions.text: Translate the following sentence into Spanish: I am twenty-five years old.
questions.explanation:
Tengo veinticinco años.

	"Traje a veinticinco personas", means I brought twenty-five people.  "Tengo veinticinco cabezas" means I have twenty-five heads.  "Traduciré veinticinco poemas" means I will translate twenty-five poems.

questions.text: Which of the following plays was written by Molière?
questions.explanation:
Tartuffe.

	The actual French title of "Tartuffe" is "L'Imposteur".

questions.text: What does the first "T" in TNT stand for?
questions.explanation:
tri.

	TNT stands for trinitrotoluene. TNT is a component of dynamite. Alfred Nobel made his fortune by mixing TNT with sawdust to make it stable enough to be useful,forming it into paper wrapped sticks of uniform size so each charge was of fairly equal power. Due to its instability, dynamite is of no military use, however, Cast TNT is used as the explosive in many artillery shells and hand grenades.  (Thanks to tombogan03884 for this information.)

Turkey.

	The capital of Taiwan is Taipei. The capital of Tunisia is Tunis. The capital of Tonga is Nuku'alofa.
